page.title: 06PRIDEWOOD HOP FARM ASHPERTON
page.content: This farm grows the variety 'Goldings', which suits the soil and sells well for the brewing of bitter beer. During the hop growing season the work is 'pegging', 'stringing', 'bracing', when two strings are tied together for strength, 'tying', when the hop shoots are twisted round the strings, and 'picking' in September when the strings are cut down and fed through machines by casual workers mainly from the Midlands. During the hop growing season the hops are often sprayed against 'mould' and 'mildew' but the dreaded disease is 'wilt' for which no cure has been found. It can be carried by wind, birds or on tractor tyres and the only remedy is to clear the land. The price of hops has fallen sharply from Â£450 a 'pocket' in 1980 to Â£150 in 1984.
